TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ResponseClassificationHandler extends System.Object

Docs.summary:
A type that analyzes an HTTP message and determines if the response it holds should be treated as an error response. A classifier of this type may use information from the request, the response, or other message property to decide whether and how to classify the message.
This type's TryClassify method allows chaining together handlers before applying default classifier logic. If a handler in the chain returns false from TryClassify, the next handler will be tried, and so on. The first handler that returns true will determine whether the response is an error.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
public abstract bool TryClassify (Azure.Core.HttpMessage message, out bool isError);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool TryClassify(class Azure.Core.HttpMessage message, [out] bool& isError) cil managed
Public MustOverride Function TryClassify (message As HttpMessage, ByRef isError As Boolean) As Boolean
abstract member TryClassify : Azure.Core.HttpMessage * bool -> bool

Docs.param: Whether the message's response should be considered an error.
Docs.summary: Populates the isError out parameter to indicate whether or not to classify the message's response as an error.
Docs.returns: true if the handler had a classification for this message; false otherwise.
